docs.snippet: Health specialists said a travel ban would do more harm than good because it would isolate impoverished nations that are barely able to cope with the Ebola outbreak....
docs.lead_paragraph: Health specialists said a travel ban would do more harm than good because it would isolate impoverished nations that are barely able to cope with the Ebola outbreak.
docs.abstract: Public health officials say a travel ban on people coming from the three West African nations struggling with Ebola virus outbreak would be ineffective and difficult to carry out and would not entirely prevent people in Ebola-hit countries from entering the United States; health specialists say, that ultimately, a ban would do more harm than good because it would isolate impoverished nations already barely able to cope with virus.

headline.main: Experts Oppose Ebola Travel Ban, Saying It Would Cut Off Worst-Hit Countries
headline.print_headline: Experts Oppose Travel Ban, Saying It Would Cut Off Worst-Hit Countries

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Monday, June 2 A group of 10 Americans, ignoring warnings from the Justice Department, flew to Teheran over the weekend to participate in a conference on Iranian grievances against the United States....
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Monday, June 2 A group of 10 Americans, ignoring warnings from the Justice Department, flew to Teheran over the weekend to participate in a conference on Iranian grievances against the United States.
docs.abstract: Group of 10 Americans, ignoring warnings from Justice Department, flies to Teheran to participate in conference on Iranian grievances against US; group, which includes former Atty Gen Ramsey Clark, makes trip despite Carter Administration's ban on travel by Americans to Iran and against advice of State Department, which says it fears Americans presence will be used for propaganda purposes; group issues statement saying that their participation at conference is important step in alleviating atmosphere of confrontation between US and Iran; American Friends Service Committee spokesman Gail Pressberg says committee is not sponsoring trip, although one of its members Mary Anderson is participating; other members of delegation listed (M)

headline.main: 10 Americans Fly to Iran Parley In Defiance of Carter Travel Ban; 'A Needed Dialogue' 10 Americans Fly to Iran, Defying U.S. Travel Ban

byline.original: By JANET BATTAILE Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The couple, Matthew and Grace Huang of Los Angeles, had hoped to leave Sunday but were thwarted by Qatari bureaucracy....
docs.lead_paragraph: The couple, Matthew and Grace Huang of Los Angeles, had hoped to leave Sunday but were thwarted by Qatari bureaucracy.
docs.abstract: Matthew and Grace Huang petition attorney general's office to rescind travel ban that has prevented them from leaving Qatar; couple was acquitted in death of their adopted daughter after nearly two-year legal ordeal in country.

headline.main: American Couple in Qatar, Cleared in Child’s Death, Petition to Lift Travel Ban
headline.print_headline: Qatar: American Couple Petitions to Lift Travel Ban

docs.snippet: The House voted again today to approve a measure that would effectively lift the ban on most travel to Cuba. But travelers considering a Cuban vacation should not rush to pack their bags.    The 240-to-186 vote on the amendment to a spending bill ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The House voted again today to approve a measure that would effectively lift the ban on most travel to Cuba. But travelers considering a Cuban vacation should not rush to pack their bags. The 240-to-186 vote on the amendment to a spending bill seemed to reflect a growing sentiment in Congress that many sanctions on President Fidel Castro's government have outlived their usefulness.
docs.abstract: House votes, 240 to 186, for measure that would effectively lift ban on most travel to Cuba; vote reflects growing sentiment in Congress that many sanctions on Pres Fidel Castro's government have outlived their usefulness; members of House Republican leadership who oppose lifting sanctions are expected to intervene and make certain measure dies this year, as they did with similar measure last year (S)

headline.main: A Vote to Lift a Cuba Ban

docs.snippet: Russian immigration authorities recently turned back a close ally of President Viktor A. Yushchenko of Ukraine at the St. Petersburg airport in a sign of lingering animosity between the countries after the 2004 revolution in Ukraine. Russian offic...
docs.lead_paragraph: Russian immigration authorities recently turned back a close ally of President Viktor A. Yushchenko of Ukraine at the St. Petersburg airport in a sign of lingering animosity between the countries after the 2004 revolution in Ukraine. Russian officials said they banned Petro O. Poroshenko, a chocolate and television magnate and former Ukrainian national security adviser, on Feb. 3 in retaliation for Ukraine's visa ban on Russian ultranationalist politician Vladimir V. Zhirinovsky and others, Interfax reported. ANDREW E. KRAMER
docs.abstract: Russian immigration authorities recently turned back Petro O Poroshenko, close ally of Pres Viktor A Yushchenko of Ukraine, at St Petersburg airport in sign of lingering animosity between countries after 2004 revolution in Ukraine (S)

Eaton Republican, of New Jersey, chairman of the House Committee on Foreign Affairs, declared tonight that the Russian Government was now engaged in an "obvious campaign" to "intimidate and to carry beyond its borders and through the forum of the United Nations its own conceptions of bow to rule men.
